stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Phishing Email with Pleasantly Surprised Theme
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 24 March 2015, a phishing email was sent from bigslurp@comcast.net with the subject "Pleasantly surprised". The email included the malicious attachment Pleasantly surprised.zip (MD5: 94783ce7c8b938dee9073d0b20e3283a), which contained the Gh0st remote administration tool (RAT). The Gh0st RAT called back to www.mybroiler.com.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: --- BEGIN EMAIL HEADER --- Received: from resomta-po-12v.sys.comcast.net ([96.114.154.236]) by resqmta-po-01v.sys.comcast.net with comcast id 7S5g1q00456HXL001S5g2L; Tue, 24 Mar 2015 14:05:40 +0000 Received: from resmail-po-108v.sys.comcast.net ([162.150.176.118]) by resomta-po-12v.sys.comcast.net with comcast id 7S5g1q0012ZeuZ601S5gTj; Tue, 24 Mar 2015 14:05:40 +0000 Date: Tue, 24 Mar 2015 14:05:39 +0000 (UTC) From: bigslurp@comcast.net To: [REDACTED] Subject: Pleasantly surprised --- END EMAIL HEADER ---
This is a Zip file with an embedded gh0st RAT installer/implant.

This is the Gh0st Rat installer/implant. It installs itself as a service for persistence at registry location
"HKLM\SYSTEM\ControlSet001\Services\INTER4\Description"
and contains the following name and description: Name: "INTER4" Description: "INTER4" The implant calls out to the domain www.mybroiler.com over TCP port 10005 with a 5 byte "FWKJG" gh0st RAT header.
The file Pleasantly surprised.exe (MD5 8b1af864a0e2a191f01d97b46720a162) calls out to this Command and Control over port 10005.
